paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Y114S, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.phenotype: hereditary ATTR amyloidosis with progressive cardiomyopathy, carpal tunnel syndrome, hypothyroidism, and small fiber neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive dyspnea on exertion, dysesthesia in both hands, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, hypothyroidism, small fiber neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 65-year-old Japanese man was admitted to our hospital after a 3-year history of progressive dyspnea on exertion.

functional_data.summary: The variant Y114S is associated with a low concentration of a highly amyloidogenic variant TTR in the blood.

variants.segregation_data: No family history of heart disorder or neuromuscular disease was reported.
variants.additional_notes: The patient died of heart failure 5 years after disease onset.
key_quotes: The clinical characteristics included progressive cardiomyopathy with a poor vital prognosis, a late onset of disease, sporadic occurrence, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, hypothyroidism, and mild small fiber neuropathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant Y114S was successfully extracted.
